turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: So does it look a lot different?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Here and there. Restaurant, uh, that's the main expansion. Tables've been moved around; the big man's office, I dunno, might be upstairs now.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: That guy knows you?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah, uh. Mike. That's Mike.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, what happened --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: There went my... damn... well, doesn't seem like security's all that switched... Ash, shit, this mustache is starting to fall off. I gotta fix this thing --  -- drink this for me.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We get to the bridge, we're all right!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, the ice is --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get to the bridge!  HEY! HEY! DOWN HERE!

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, stay here, don't move, stay right here --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: All I wanted... was to make it home... for a little of Dad's turkey, and Mom's stuffing... Aunt Lisbeth's acorn gravy... Aunt Mary's cranberry buns...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: We'll get there, baby... we'll get there...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...Haven't had cranberry buns... in five whole years...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Shh, now. Rest now. Two years, Nick. You haven't had cranberry buns in two years.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You saved my life.  You could have run, but you didn't. You saved me.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You saved me.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I saved you because I love you, Nick.  Why'd you save me?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I'm sorry, Nick... I'm so sorry...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Don't say my name...

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I love you, Nick...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ash. Don't say it. Don't say my name.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: They'll have guns.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You said they've run guns, in their trucks. So they'll have guns. To do this robbery. They'll have serious guns.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I don't know...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We'll need one.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm going to have to be inside that casino. When it happens. I'll need to be part of it. I can't just be drawing some map.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Nick, what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We need to find a way to make me part of it.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Part of... with them?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He wants to see your map.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm almost done.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: He says he wants it now.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: If he wanted a photographic memory, he shoulda kidnapped one. I'm working on it here.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: How are we gonna do this, Nick?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You're the getaway girl. The money's gonna get to you eventually. Gonna be my job to be the guy who walks outta there with it. But I can't do that without a gun. Any luck talking to him?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Bullets or no bullets, he won't do it.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Is there any way you could get into his truck?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We need a gun, Ash. We need a gun...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Here's the Picasso. Is he in his room?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: They all are. Football's on.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Keep 'em there for a little while.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I don't know where you're going. But I'm going home.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: We go together, Nick. Wherever... we go together. Remember?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Well. I'm going home.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: WHERE'S THE FUCKING CASH, NICK!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah. That's love.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You... you... YOU --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We still gonna spend Christmas together?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I saved your life.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You shouldn't have.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: He did love you, you know. Nick. He did love you.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Who wouldn't.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Merry Christmas, Rudy.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm glad it was me.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: Merry Christmas.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Rudy. How'd you know my name?

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You said Merry Christmas, Rudy.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: I... you told me your name was Rudy. You told me a million times, back in the truck, telling me you weren't Nick --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No --

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You were screaming you weren't Nick! And we just didn't fucking believe you!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: But I never said Rudy.

turns.speaker: ASHLEY
turns.text: You said it a million times!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I never told you my name.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You... you don't know me --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Oh, I know you, Nick. I know you real well.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, you can't --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: The hell I can't.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Who are you now.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You got the wrong guy! She thinks I'm Nick, I'm not!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Put him in the truck.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I was in the joint with him! I knew about him and her, okay!? I took his place!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You what...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I got out, Nick didn't! I pretended I was him! I knew about her letters! Jesus Christ, whatever you want from him -- I'm not Nick!  I -- I just wanted to be --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You're not Nick Mason...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I shared his cell!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: But you were saying you were...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: So you could get with my sister.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: So you could get down her chimney.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: And you think telling me that's gonna help your cause.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You're a good writer, Nick. I give this writing an A-plus.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I never worked at no casino.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Hey. She says she loves you, Nick.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: She says a lot of things.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: She's getting you to help us... 'cause she knows if you don't, you're dead. You just tell us what we need to know, you two live happily ever after. My sister loves you, motherfucker, and I ain't gonna have you break her heart.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Wish I had a brother like you.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: A girl says she loves you, you say something.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I had better sex in prison.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Heyyy. Be nice, convict. We're gonna be working together here.  Get him back in the rig.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Where's she work?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Wrote you a hundred letters, didn't she? Where's she work?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: J.C. Penney. Beauty and fragrances.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What's her middle name?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Samantha.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What'd they call her in high school?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Bam Bam.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What'd they call her in college?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What college.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Where'd she drop her cherry?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Be more specific.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: A station wagon in Canada.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What's her greatest fear?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Her brother.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Wrong, Nick. It's drowning.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No. It's her brother.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Let's get back on the road. It's time to start talking, Nick. Time to start telling tales --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Nick don't talk till Nick gets something.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You knew the place --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: How much money's in that casino? Day-to-day.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: The hell you don't.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Five million?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You wrote Ash that letter, you told her that story 'bout working Christmas Eve, bout how they'd send half the security guys home, nobody comin, in that night. And the rest of you got shit-faced drinking hot buttered rum. That a true story now?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Christmas... Eve...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You know where the guards are. You know how to get in and out. You know where the money is.  We're taking down that casino, convict. You're the guy gonna tell us how.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Hey, it's... been two years --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: We got faith in you, Nick Mason.  You're our inside man.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Hell. Ten?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: And which of these doors here lead up to the security level?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I said, who the hell made the map?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: This isn't the Tomahawk.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What the fuck are you talking about.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: This is the front entrance, right? You get through the slots, you hit craps here, not blackjack. Blackjack's here to here -- lined up. What's this, the cage? Cage is over there, hard to get to, you got it all mixed around --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: We walked the place for a week.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: And I worked there. For a year.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: They wouldn't have changed the security setup.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: When I worked there, this was Bangs, office. Back here. He kept a little safe in the... uh, the wall, money held take for himself, skim from the Indians. Called it the... uh...  ...the Powwow Safe.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: So what the hell good are you...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You'd have to get me inside.  Get inside, watch where the money's moving, see where the guards are going. Then I could work with your map.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Wrong, convict. You walk in there, they recognize you.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: They won't recognize me.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Why not.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Trust me. They won't recognize me.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: We'll trust you when we're rich. Why not.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: 'Cause you're gonna get me a disguise.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Bring back some memories, Nick?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: More than you know.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Rather be back in the Mountain?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Might as well be.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Don't have Weather Channel in the Mountain, Nick.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: A cowboy. You're going to send me into an Indian casino disguised as a cowboy. Have you thought this entirely through?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Put it on.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You're a country-western singer up from Nashville for the the holidays. Visiting your Grandma on the lake, driving into the Tomahawk for some scotch and slots. You only play the slots, you got that? Don't want no dealer friend of yours recognizing you, you sidle up to shoot some craps.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What kind of half-ass cowboy plays the slots?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You do.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: At least gimme video poker.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Shut the fuck up. You play what your girlfriend plays. Ashley's going in with you. You talk to her, otherwise you don't talk to nobody. You walk the room as many times as you want, but the second you come out, I want to know the run of the place.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Do I get a country-western name?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You get recognized, convict, You get a country-western funeral.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Y'know what, guys? I woke up this morning, I got a really lucky feeling going on. I mean it, I'm feeling that good. I wouldn't be surprised if I walk in there, pull a handle and hit jackpot. Hell, we wouldn't even have to --

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Get out.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You got one hour.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm gonna need some money.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ten dollars? What do I do with ten dollars?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Don't tip.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Monster. If we're working together here, we gotta be working together. I can't walk in there looking like the Lone Fucking Ranger with ten bucks to throw down. You don't want me getting noticed, right? Not getting noticed costs a guy at least a couple hundred.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: A for effort, Nick, honestly, A for effort and an honorary degree. I'm surprised you never escaped from the Mountain.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...never... tried...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Nick, here's what we're gonna do. In the spirit of the season, I'm going to give you a chance. I understand you're unhappy. Right outta the lockup, here against your will, it's the holidays and there's reruns on TV.  So we're gonna have a contest.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Got something to say to me, Nick?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...ttt..tt... two out of three?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What'd you tell that casino manager?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Nnn... nothing...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You were talking to him! What'd you tell him!?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Nothing... I promise-nothing...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: MAYBE SOMETHING ABOUT A ROBBERY?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: NO!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: He thought I was some gambler... he didn't know me... he didn't recognize me!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I been driving rigs a long time, Nick. Four, five million miles of road. Worked for people who wouldn't keep me on less I was driving fifteen hours a day. Tell 'em I needed sleep, I needed rest, shit, they'll hire someone else...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: It's time for me... to be working for me. I want mine, Nick. And I need you.  Did you tell your manager there's gonna be a robbery?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: No, Gabriel... no...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Man, Monster... just... just don't start trying to hit me...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Nick. I been trying to hit you.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Start singing.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I have no gifts to bring, pa-rumpum- pum-pum

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Sing it in pictures, Nick.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Across from blackjack, there's a security doorway. Keypad access.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: What's the code?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Uh... they change it every month. I wouldn't know.  If there's trouble on the floor, you'll get security coming through. what you gotta do, is get inside that doorway once they do. You gotta draw 'em out.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: So. You're gonna need a man through here, two men at the cage, one to cover the count. You're gonna need a lookout outside, a sweeper through the back, and a gun guarding the front.  You need six.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: We got five. Putting Ashley outside.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You need six.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: NO.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You go in with five, you're either leaving an alarm free or an exit free. Someone hits an alarm, you're fucked. Someone gets to a phone, gets outside, 'cross the street, whatever, you're fucked. You need six.  Six is me.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You guys get caught, I go away for good. I got an interest in making sure you don't. You need a sixth man covering an exit. What're you gonna do about it.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: I want a map of that security level. Every room, every guard, every thing.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Six men means six guns.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: No way.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I'm no threat without a gun.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: No, you're not.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: There'll be people in that casino. I can't keep them from leaving if I don't get a gun. I don't need bullets, Monster... but I gotta be a threat.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: No gun.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Well. What you guys have to plan out, then... is how you're going to get to that cage and that security level before anybody realizes anything's wrong. Running in with ski masks and bullets flying ain't gonna do it.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: That part, Nick... was planned out the day I read your letters.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What. We all gonna dress up like cowboys?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Not cowboys, Nick. Not cowboys.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You gotta be kidding me.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: 'Tis the season, convict.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Can't be attracting attention, right?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What, we walking in there and delivering toys?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: You are lucky, convict. You're spending Christmas with the birthday boy himself --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Hey! HEY! THERE IS A POWWOW SAFE!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Buncha guys in red suits busted in, they'll say. Started shooting. They won't be able to remember... if it was three, or four... or five. Four dead Santas and some burned-up cash. Merry Christmas, The End.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Was it your plan, Monster? Or was it hers.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Get in the CAR!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: How'd you know my name...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Ash?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: How'd you know my name was Rudy.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Ash?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: How'd you know my name.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Hey. They got a shitload of cookies.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Take 'em.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: How 'bout the tree? You want the tree?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Leave the tree.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Here ya go, convict. We cased the place in the fall, got the layout down. What you're gonna do is show us where each of these doors go, what the upstairs level looks like, where they got the alarms, all of it.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: And where they hide the real money.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Who's robbin' who here, Gabriel...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Get in there and watch 'em. Watch their every fuckin' move.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Where the HELL did he go?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Monster. There never was a structure change. This place was built the same from day one.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: Mister. I'm begging, 'kay? I'm begging. This is not some card club, 'kay? This is the Tomahawk. We're an international gaming destination. We're in guidebooks. You can't do this... you can't do this to me...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Show's over.

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: He won't tell us where it is. The Powwow Safe.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I don't know... what you're...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: THE POWWOW SAFE! WHERE IS THE POWWOW SAFE!

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: What... Powwow...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: The Powwow Safe where you steal your money! Where you cheat your Indians!

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I don't steal any --

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: ...so where is he?

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: Where is he?! Where is he?!

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: He's not Nick Mason...

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I can't go back to Vegas...

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: OPEN IT!!!

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I CAN'T! GO BACK! I CAN'T! GO BACK! I CAN'T! GO BACK!

turns.speaker: GABRIEL
turns.text: GO!!!

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: There's no snow in Vegas, 'kay? They don't know it, they don't want it, they got laws against the stuff. They got Egypt down there, right, they got Monte Carlo, Hawaii, they got ancient Rome, but where's the Winter Castle, right? Where's the Swiss miss Chalet? Where's the Big Fucking Igloo?

turns.speaker: YOUNG GOVERNOR
turns.text: We understand you, Mr. Bangs.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: Capades? They don't do it. Mittens? Outlawed. Why?

turns.speaker: YOUNG GOVERNOR
turns.text: We're aware of your position.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: Because down there this is money. Up here this is heat.  You wanted Vegas quality, I brought it to you. You wanted Vegas press, I gave it to you. But guys, please, guys... I can't get you Vegas profits... till one of ya does some spirit dance and does something about this snow.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I'm bringing in this great showroom act next week; these three Russian girls, they look like Meryl Streep, they can juggle anything.

turns.speaker: YOUNG GOVERNOR
turns.text: Mr. Bangs.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: Guys. We're doing it right, here. $5.99 prime rib? Nobody does that in Michigan. Nobody.

turns.speaker: YOUNG GOVERNOR
turns.text: The tribe is concerned that many of your... new ideas are not resulting in any new venues.

turns.speaker: JACK BANGS
turns.text: I'm putting liquor in the drinks, I'm giving 10-times odds on craps, I got the girls showing sixteen-percent more skin! Show me another buffet's gonna offer you Coke and Pepsi! Whaddya want me to do?!

turns.speaker: YOUNG GOVERNOR
turns.text: We want to see our casino making money again, Mr. Bangs. Making money for our community.

turns.speaker: JUMPY
turns.text: The Powwow Safe?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: His personal safe, he gave it a name. Now you're telling me they've taken his office, put the buffet there? Then who knows what else they changed.

turns.speaker: JUMPY
turns.text: What about the Powwow Safe?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JUMPY
turns.text: The Powwow Safe. The secret safe. You said the manager's got a safe in his office where he hides skim money.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Oh. Right. Yeah. That's, uh upstairs. Uh. Here. Powwow Safe.

turns.speaker: JUMPY
turns.text: Hi, Santa Claus, how are you. He's with Sears, I'm with Wal-Mart, twas the season...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: We're all outta gifts, boys and girls, but we got charitable donations!

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Goddamn, Merlin. There any part of the day you don't smoke?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: There anytime you don't got a mouthful of shit?

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Cancer-sucker.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Acid-chewer.

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: That motherfucker --

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: And Monster... he was talking with the casino manager. Nick was talking to him.

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: Knew a guy in Joliet, smoked ten packs a day like you. His lungs got so black they couldn't find 'em with an x-ray.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: That right? Shit. I used to run rigs for a guy loved your chaw there. Shit rotted out his tongue, had to build him one outta silicon so the poor boy could talk. You ever see a motherfucker with a silicon fucking tongue?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: This trucker? Met a girl in a bar one night, she didn't know his situation. He's drunk, she's drunk, they get to mackin' hot and heavy and the woman swallows it. His tongue. Sucks it right down.

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: My guy would walk into a room, set off the goddamn sprinklers.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: His lips went next. You ever see some silicon-fucking-lips?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: I got a bacon too; there another bacon in there?

turns.speaker: PUG
turns.text: I got a bacon for him and a bacon for me; there's four cheeseburgers and two roast beefs --

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Somebody better give me something with some goddamn bacon --

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Thanks, sister. How are ya.

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Fuckin' freezing.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Hell yeah. You work here long?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: Five years. Since it opened.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: How long ago was your makeover?

turns.speaker: WAITRESS
turns.text: My what?!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: No, the place. The remodeling. moving everything around.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: ...but I got a girl to be with, rum- pum-pum-pum...

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Hi, Nick.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You want that for here or to go?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I been in Iron Mountain for two years, truck driver. I do one more crime, I'm back there for good, so fuck you and fuck your sister and fuck your trucker friends. You want to hear about some goddamn job of mine? I want some hot-goddamn-chocolate.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Buffet. Whaddya think it is?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Buffet is by the goddamn bar! What the hell kind of map is this?!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Having romance problems, Romeo?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Not with you.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What the hell was that about --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: He didn't recognize me. Back off, willya? He didn't recognize me.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: What you gotta worry about first is the guards. Place doesn't look much richer than when I worked there, so let's figure you're gonna have to deal with ten of 'em. There'll be two on the floor, walking the room, that leaves eight up above. Eyes in the sky. They see something up, they're the ones who'll hit the silent alarm and you're fucked.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: How do we take them out?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You gotta get someone upstairs.

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: How do we do that?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: What about the money?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: You lock down security, you move behind the cage. You hit the Count Room. There'll be a guy in there but he's got no guns; room's accessed by another code. Cashiers'll know it. They'll have alarms.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Here's my present to you, truck drivers --

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: Where the hell's Gabriel?

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: DROP 'EM! DROP, DROP, DROP!!!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: DROP THE GUNS! NOW!

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You knew there were guns in here!

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Merlin, I didn't know --

turns.speaker: MERLIN
turns.text: You got Pug killed! You tried to get ME killed! You just lost your Get- Outta-Jail-Free --

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: I promise you, I didn't know!

turns.speaker: ZOOK
turns.text: Monsters in the gelatin...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: It's a roach, guy --

turns.speaker: ZOOK
turns.text: There are monsters...  ...in the gelatin...

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Oh, man --

turns.speaker: ZOOK
turns.text: THERE ARE MONSTERS IN THE GELATIN!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fuckin, Zookerman --

turns.speaker: ZOOK
turns.text: THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN! THERE ARE MONSTERS! IN THE GELATIN!

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What's the first thing, man? What's the first thing you're gonna do?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Haven't thought about it.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Hell you haven't.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get to thinking about it, it won't happen.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: We walk outta here, we hit that road, what's the first thing you're gonna do.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Ain't there yet.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Three days, man.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Fuckin' Christmas, man. Fuckin, Christmas on the outs.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Hot chocolate.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Get a hot mug of chocolate.  First thing I'm gonna do.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: And a slice of pecan pie, right?

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: And some pecan pie.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: She's gonna be out there, man. Right there. Right there waiting.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Gonna walk out of this shitstorm and right into her arms.

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Got us a motel out Highway 5, bringing her own damn sheets, you read that part? Silk damn sheets. Lock ourselves in the whole week, drinking wine, taking baths, man, see if they got those room service steaks... anything I want to do. Remember when she wrote that? Anything I want...

turns.speaker: RUDY
turns.text: Yeah. Fuckin' Christmas.
